text: Discuss Sunday's request

title: Mission Description
content: Although it is not a request to formally join theExpress Crew, a former opponent's request to travel alongside you is still worthy of due consideration. That being said... You would really enjoy having a junior you can bully— you mean give guidance to.

text: Some time later...

speaker: Welt
line: So, this is why I brought him here.

speaker: Welt
line: Mr. Sunday wants to join us on the Express . Of course, I can't make that decision alone.

speaker: Himeko
line: But if you didn't support this idea, you wouldn't have brought him back.

speaker: Himeko
line: Welt, I trust your judgment. If someone is willing to join us on our journey, the Express will be open to them.

speaker: Himeko
line: ▶ But this time is a bit different. Before making any decision, ( Trailblazer ), I want to hear what you think.

text: Me?

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: In this battle, you were the one who directly confronted him. Your opinion holds the most weight.

text: I want to hear everyone's opinion.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: But in this battle, you were the one who directly confronted him. Your opinion holds the most weight.

text: I don't have anything to say.

children.speaker: Himeko
children.line: Oh, really? But your face tells me otherwise. Come on, spill it. Your opinion holds the most weight.

speaker: Sunday
line: I learn the most valuable lessons from my past opponents. Please say whatever's on your mind.

text: You are a noble person.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ You're a noble person. I can't deny that you always have compassion in your heart, even though we may view things differently.

text: You always want to be in control.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ You're a perfectionist, always trying to control everything — even when it comes to yourself. Although, we're going to be traveling further into the unknown once we leave Penacony . I guess a change of pace could do everyone some good.

text: You've disappointed many people.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ You know what I'm going to say. Tons of people trusted you, but you let them all down — even your closest family. Don't you forget that.

text: (All choices lead to the following options)
I agree with what you stand for.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ I believe there is a way — a better way — to achieve your ideal. Seven rest days may be just a metaphor... But I look forward to the day when it comes true.

text: Have some hope in humanity.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Maybe you're too pessimistic about humanity, but the Trailblaze isn't like that. We had to learn to have faith before embarking on this path. You must do the same.

text: You have an unrealistic ideal.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Ideals are good to have, but nothing good comes from getting carried away in fantasies. I can never agree with how you dragged everyone into that world of yours just to fulfill an illusory dream.

text: (All choices lead to the following options)
We can be friends.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Nothing is for certain, anyway. An enemy yesterday may be a friend today.

text: You're a worthy adversary.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Anyhow, you've been an unforgettable adversary to me, even though I haven't been trailblazing for long...

text: I don't agree with Mr. Yang...

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ In any case, I'm gonna have to disagree with Mr. Yang...

text: (All choices lead to the following options)
He can join the Astral Express Crew.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Welcome aboard the Astral Express.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I second that.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well, you did get nerfed after turning into a good guy... So, I guess I'm okay, too!

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Thank you all for your forgiveness.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Perhaps I'll find the answer I'm looking for on this journey. And when that day comes, it'll be farewell.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Until then, rest assured that I will do my best to fulfill my duty as your companion.

text: Finally, I'm no longer the newbie.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Come on, you're taking over as newbie.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: He's just traveling with us, not an actual member of the Express crew yet! Your newbie status is untouchable.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'm fine with that.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Thank you all for your forgiveness.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Perhaps I'll find the answer I'm looking for on this journey. And when that day comes, it'll be farewell.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Until then, rest assured that I will do my best to fulfill my duty as your companion.

text: Maybe we should hear everyone else's opinion.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ I have nothing more to add. I'll let you all decide, then.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'm fine with that.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Well, you did get nerfed after turning into a good guy... So, I guess I'm okay, too!

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Thank you all for your forgiveness.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Perhaps I'll find the answer I'm looking for on this journey. And when that day comes, it'll be farewell.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Until then, I will do my best to fulfill my duty as a passenger.

text: I'll have my eye on you at all times.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ You should know that I'll be watching your every move.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'll help you with that.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I guess it shouldn't be a problem. After all, he did get nerfed after turning into a good guy.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Thank you all for your forgiveness.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Perhaps I'll find the answer I'm looking for on this journey. And when that day comes, it'll be farewell.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Until then, I will do my best to fulfill my duty as a passenger.

text: I won't accept this, no matter what is said.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ I won't pretend I'm okay with it. You can be our passenger, but you're not joining us.

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Of course, you have every reason to feel that way. In that case, I won't inconvenience you all any more than necessary. I'll find a stop to disembark at once the Express departs Asdana .

children.speaker: Sunday
children.line: Until then, rest assured that I will behave as expected of a passenger.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Uh... I guess that'll have to do, then.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'll keep a close eye on him in the meantime.

speaker: Himeko
line: ...Looks like we've come to a decision.

speaker: Himeko
line: Remember to keep the conductor in the loop, too.

speaker: Welt
line: Now that our business on Penacony is settled, it's about time we get back on track and prepare for our next warp jump?

speaker: Himeko
line: Yeah, but let me try contacting Madam Herta again before we set off. She helped us look into Amphoreus , even though nothing new came up... I should at least let her know we're leaving.

speaker: Himeko
line: I tried contacting the space station several times, but I never got any response. Maybe there's a problem with the Interastral Network.

speaker: Himeko
line: It shouldn't be anything to worry about. What could happen on the geniuses' home turf? Even the Antimatter Legion wouldn't stand a chance...

speaker: Himeko
line: For all we know, Madam Herta could be making a move again.

text: (Screen fades to black)

speaker: Herta
line: No, we're still not quite there.

text: (Cutsceneplays)

children.speaker: Asta
children.line: Alright, it's time to leave the space station.

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: Indeed, this is only a minor ripple that no one will ever notice...

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: So, you must also understand, for a genius...

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: The importance of asking questions outweighs the importance of the answers themselves.

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: So-called magic has its own set of principles.

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: There are no mysteries in this universe that cannot be solved.

children.speaker: Herta
children.line: So...

children.speaker: The Herta
children.line: All-seeing presence —

children.speaker: The Herta
children.line: I ask you this—

children.speaker: The Herta
children.line: What is divinity?

text: (Cutscene ends)

(Mission complete)
(Visitor Verification)

children.text: (Fuguehas become a visitor to the Express. You might come across Fugue when you return to the Express)
